channel.title: 2015s on Wesley Tian
channel.description: Recent content in 2015s on Wesley Tian

item.title: Climbing Mt. Olympus
item.description: Pic: View from Mt. Olympus Pic: Sunrise at Refuge A I always like to plan things out before I do them. Especially with hiking mountains in a country of which language I did not know, it was especially crucial for me to plan things out before hand. I searched online and found close to nothing that would help me prepare for Mt. Olympus. I basically went to Greece with no knowledge of Mt.

item.title: Climbing the Half Dome
item.description: It’s been nearly a whole year since I summited the half dome in Yosemite Valley National Park. One of my favorite hiking adventures of all time, below is the journal entry that I wrote after the hike. A first-person POV video of the same path I took. 9/1/2015 It’s currently 3:28AM and I just really wanted to record my thoughts and experiences before I forget them. Up until now I have not had the chance to get on my computer.

item.title: A Journey of a Thousand Miles Begins With a Single Step
item.description: Sometimes you just don’t feel like going to the gym. For one reason or another, the real reason is just because you’re too lazy and don’t feel like it. Don’t make excuses. But that’s another point. Listen up, because I’m going to teach you a way that has made everything for me easier. It should work for anything that you’ve been doing routinely, but just can’t keep it that way. Your brain works in strange ways and in order to appeal to your brain you have to take advantage of how your brain works.
